CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Further fine - tuning of the LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer by structural modification may improve V OC and promote the utilization of more NIR light by the lower bandgap materials . In conclusion , a highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response , PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , based on alternating 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione units has been synthesized. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has high hole mobility ( 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved. Considering the sufficiently high I SC values of this system , more promising photovoltaic performance is thought to be achievable by using other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels , such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH. 14 Further device optimization and the synthesis of new μmRpolymers are currently in progress and will be reported in due course. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole and

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |
| N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole |
| bis-PCBM 13 |
| Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH |
| μmRpolymers |

The identified material names are precisely presented from the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| ------------ |
| PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) |
| N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole |
| bis-PCBM 13 |
| Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH |

The identified material names are precisely presented from the original paragraph, with the removal of non-material related entities such as "Further", "In conclusion", "highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response", "based on", "alternating 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2, 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione units", "has been synthesized", "high hole mobility ( 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm", "The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated", "and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved", "Considering the sufficiently high I SC values of this system", "more promising photovoltaic performance is thought to be achievable by using other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels", "such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH", "Further device optimization and the synthesis of new μmRpolymers are currently in progress and will be reported in due course".

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Further fine - tuning of the LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer by structural modification may improve V OC and promote the utilization of more NIR light by the lower bandgap materials . In conclusion , a highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response , PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , based on alternating 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione units has been synthesized. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has high hole mobility ( 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved. Considering the sufficiently high I SC values of this system , more promising photovoltaic performance is thought to be achievable by using other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels , such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH. 14 Further device optimization and the synthesis of new μmRpolymers are currently in progress and will be reported in due course. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole and

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value                                       |
|----------------------------------------------------|
| LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer                |
| VOC (Voltage Open Circuit)                          |
| 14.87 mA / cm^2 (shortcircuit current)             |
| 2.71% (Power Conversion Efficiency)                |
| Hole mobility: 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1                   |
| Photocurrent response wavelengths: 300 nm to 1.1 μm |
| Isc (Implicit, not explicitly stated, but mentioned) |

The paragraph mentions "highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response, PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)" having high hole mobility (0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm, and achieving high short-circuit current (14.87 mA / cm^2) and PCE (2.71%). It also mentions the sufficiently high Isc values of the system and the potential use of other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels, such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH. Therefore, we can infer that the Isc value is also a material property of the photovoltaic system.

The paragraph also mentions the synthesis of new μmRpolymers, but no specific property values are given for them.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                                       |
|----------------------------------------------------|
| LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer                |
| Voltage Open Circuit (VOC)                         |
| Short-circuit current (Isc)                        |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE)                   |
| Hole mobility: 0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1                   |
| Photocurrent response wavelengths: 300 nm to 1.1 μm |
| LUMO energy levels of fullerene derivatives (bis-PCBM 13, Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH) |

The paragraph mentions "highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response, PDTP-DTDPP(Bu)" having high hole mobility (0.05 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm, and achieving high short-circuit current (14.87 mA / cm^2) and PCE (2.71%). It also mentions the sufficiently high Isc values of the system and the potential use of other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels, such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH. Therefore, we can infer that the Isc value is also a material property of the photovoltaic system. The paragraph also mentions the synthesis of new μmRpolymers, but no specific property values are given for them. The LUMO energy levels of the fullerene derivatives are mentioned as material properties that could potentially improve the photovoltaic performance of the system.
